intro: Justicia faulknerae, commonly known as Falkner's flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
